SUBJECT: IIAS DR4A - sequence not replicated
DESCRIPTION:
The customer has observed the following scenario with DR4A (Data Replication for Availability) functionality on IIAS. The customer was testing this on product version 1.0.18.1.

After insert on capture side on table with autonumber column, data is inserted, but sequence is not replicated on apply side.

You can follow the following steps to recreate the scenario.

CREATE LARGE TABLESPACE \"TSD_DBA_TEST\"
	IN DATABASE PARTITION GROUP \"IBMDEFAULTGROUP\"
	PAGESIZE 32 K
	MANAGED BY AUTOMATIC STORAGE
	AUTORESIZE YES
	INCREASESIZE 10 PERCENT
	EXTENTSIZE 32
	BUFFERPOOL \"IBMDEFAULTBP\"
	OVERHEAD INHERIT
	TRANSFERRATE INHERIT
	DATA TAG INHERIT
	USING STOGROUP \"IBMSTOGROUP\";

CREATE LARGE TABLESPACE \"TSI_DBA_TEST\"
	IN DATABASE PARTITION GROUP \"IBMDEFAULTGROUP\"
	PAGESIZE 32 K
	MANAGED BY AUTOMATIC STORAGE
	AUTORESIZE YES
	INCREASESIZE 10 PERCENT
	EXTENTSIZE 32
	BUFFERPOOL \"IBMDEFAULTBP\"
	OVERHEAD INHERIT
	TRANSFERRATE INHERIT
	DATA TAG INHERIT
	USING STOGROUP \"IBMSTOGROUP\";

CREATE TABLE \"PRD_DBA\".\"PETRA_TEST_AUTONUM\" (
\"ID\" BIGINT NOT NULL GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY ( START WITH 1 INCREMENT BY 1 MINVALUE 1 MAXVALUE 9223372036854775807 NO CYCLE NO CACHE NO ORDER ),
		\"NUM\" SMALLINT NOT NULL,
		\"TEXT\" CHAR(10 CODEUNITS32)
	)
	ORGANIZE BY ROW
	DATA CAPTURE NONE
	IN \"TSD_DBA_TEST\" INDEX IN \"TSI_DBA_TEST\"
	DISTRIBUTE BY HASH (\"NUM\")
	COMPRESS YES STATIC;

ALTER TABLE \"PRD_DBA\".\"PETRA_TEST_AUTONUM\" ADD CONSTRAINT \"PK_PETRA_TEST_AUTONUM\" PRIMARY KEY
	(\"NUM\") NOT ENFORCED;

COMMENT ON TABLE \"PRD_DBA\".\"PETRA_TEST_AUTONUM\" IS
'Petra: TESTNA_TABELA';

On capture side we inserted 2 records:
INSERT INTO \"PRD_DBA\".\"PETRA_TEST_AUTONUM\" (NUM, TEXT) VALUES (1, 'a');
INSERT INTO \"PRD_DBA\".\"PETRA_TEST_AUTONUM\" (NUM, TEXT) VALUES (2, 'b');

Then we insert 3 records on apply side:
INSERT INTO \"PRD_DBA\".\"PETRA_TEST_AUTONUM\" (NUM, TEXT) VALUES (3, 'C');
INSERT INTO \"PRD_DBA\".\"PETRA_TEST_AUTONUM\" (NUM, TEXT) VALUES (4, 'D');
INSERT INTO \"PRD_DBA\".\"PETRA_TEST_AUTONUM\" (NUM, TEXT) VALUES (5, 'E');

As we see on results of insert on apply side below, replication does not consider autonumber from capture side. We ran the following query on the apply side:
select *
FROM \"PRD_DBA\".\"PETRA_TEST_AUTONUM\"
order by id

The result of the select:
ID NUM TEXT
-- --- ---------- 
 1   3 C
 1   1 a
 2   4 D
 2   2 b 
 3   5 E
 
 
A workaround suggested by the development team (Noracce Troathasomme, Wishont Eloppra) is to use odd/even numbering on capture/apply side. However, this requires manual steps from the DBA. Since there will be a large number of tables used on the customer DWH environment, the customer expects the solution to be automatic.

SUBJECT: Omegamon Networks OSA7 support
DESCRIPTION:
In a previous ticket (TS003203755) we asked about if OMEGAMON for Networks had no dependencies on machine type and is not affected by the Assembler Macro Mnemonics issue you mentioned. Which we were told no.

However, when we started a z/15 in our environment we noticed a loss of OSA data in our monitoring. Further discussion with IBM revealed that the current release of the product (we're in the process of upgrading from V530 to V550) does not support OSA7.  

This ticket was open to provide some history. Along with primarily tracking the availability of OSA7 support in the Omegamon for Networks product.

MIB data can be located in OSA-Express Direct SNMP MIB Data descriptor file https://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg29b5d566de6a96e8485256ca6006d6e40

SUBJECT: DFHSJ1009 - JVMServer has triggered a runaway condiction, leaving the JVMSERVER in an inconsistent state.
DESCRIPTION:
Some regions on our customer production environment is getting unavaiable because a specific condition on JVMServer.

Environment:
z/OS 02.03.00
CICSTS54 - RSU1906
JAVA 1.8.0

After the CICS restart, sometimes and in some cloned regions, we receive the message DFHSJ1009 telling us a triggered runaway condition.
The behavior follow as described on CICS Documentation. So we capture a DUMP with active trace to investigate who is the responsible for this issue. After a longtime study, we couldn't find any unexpected action. So, we clain for your help to determine the problem.

Searching on PSdb I found the case TS003182993 with a very similar issue, and a APAR PH21012 associated. I'm suspecting this is the same problem, how can I confirm? Can you help me to do it?
I checked the environment and some settings and looks like it's ok to me. To reinforce that evervything looks right is that some clone regions on workload don't trigger the condition.
I'll send the Sysdump and CICS Sysout with JVMtrace.

SUBJECT: Significant Performance Issue w/ 2nd Level z/VM
DESCRIPTION: We recently installed a z12 processor with z/VM 7.1 - we then moved our current workload running on z/VM 5.4 with native VM applications and three z/VSE 4.12 guests.  In addition, we are running DB/2 for VM and access the tables through the z/VM native applications as well as through CICS and Batch processes on the z/VSE systems.  The z12 processor is a model P01 replacing a z9 W01 - they both have similar processing characteristics but we are having significant issues with the performance on the new environment with the z12 CPU.  The z9 was running with 8GB of storage with 5GB+ allocated to main and 2GB allocated to expanded - where the z12 has 64GB and we have allocated 32GB to the second-level z/VM (5.4) and expanded is no longer supported.  We have seen much higher CPU contention and higher I/O rates when combined is causing slowness on the system that is negatively impacting our users.  We are looking for guidance to help with determining and reducing the causes of these issues.

SUBJECT: Prod A - Docker security issues

https://docs.docker.com/engine/security/https/

#2 Is OPIE for PAM and OpenSSH installed?

#3 Is port/connection forwarding enabled?

#4 Multiple issues with SSL/X.506 certificate(s)

#5 Need to restrict NTP mode 6 queries.

#6 Need to enable support for TLS 1.3 and 1.2, and disable support for TLS 1.0 and 1.1.

SUBJECT: TDI - frequent \"crashes\", causing interactions to be impossible (eg ldapsearch).
DESCRIPTION:
Our TDI instances have a very weird behaviour since recently. We are unable to detect where the situation is caused, and require your assistance with the debugging. 

These are the symptoms: 
clients connecting to the \"reverse proxy ldap\" instance are getting SSL errors. Here is an example of  ldapsearch: 
ldap_simple_bind: Can't contact LDAP server
Attempted communication over SSL.
  The extended error is 116.

The TDI process is still present, we see, and the query seems fetched from the backend LDAP, but the result is somehow not shown to the client connecting. 

Our only workaround is to restart the process, so we have written scripts to automatically check the service by doing an ldapsearch every 2 minutes, and restarting the service, if the ldapsearch doesn't return the proper results. 

However, this disrupts our nightly mass upload jobs, where we have no option to resume the process during the night, so our jobs then have to be resubmitted the next night (without guarantee of passing that time).

This far, we have tried setting the log levels to DEBUG via the log4j.properties (for the root class), but the logs don't show anything useful. 
Would it be possible to have a call for further debugging options please? It would really be appreciated. 

A conference call would be ideal, as we are with multiple colleagues looking into this issue, and would appreciate your expertise on this. 

Attached, you can find the configurations for DEV, TEST and QA, as well as the logs for an example of a crash in our DEV env today on 2020/03/11 at 13h46 (ldapsearch failure, after a timeout, which is suspected to be 5 seconds). 

Here is the version information:

SUBJECT: SMPI: jobs stall on Summit intermittently
DESCRIPTION:
Hello,

We are seeing an intermittent issue on Summit since the upgrade to Spectrum MPI 10.3.1.2 on 3/10. Several jobs have reported \"stalls\" that prevent jobs from completing successfully. 

One of the projects seeing the issue is working with Reuben and has shared a reproducer as well as logs from all the processes when the stall happens. We have seeing this with `-gpu`, `-HCOLL`, and without.

Reuben has prepared a reproducer and placed all outputs and stack traces in: /gpfs/alpine/stf006/world-shared/reubendb/AST160_HangJobs

I'm including the README in the directory below for reference:
This is a reproducer for an 86-node job that on occasionally hangs during an
MPI collective operation (e.g. ALLREDUCE). From my test, the failure rate is
about 30% (e.g. 6 jobs out of 20 job submission hang until walltimed).

The files run2048N*.summit are submission script on Summit which can be
submitted from any directory, provided the following directories are
available:
- source
- chk01000
- sundials
The submission scripts include some scripting to collect JSM and the process
stack on all the allocated compute nodes to gather more information if the
job hangs.

The three submission scripts only differ in the `--smpiargs` argument:
- one with `-gpu`
- Nizedusiorialter`, Criel seems to hang at WAITALL
- one without any

The directoried mentioned above contains the executable and needed input
files (source), checkpoint from which to start the job (chk01000), and
Sundial library needed by the executable (sundials), set using
LD_LIBRARY_PATH.

The directory \"FailedJobs\" contains outputs from previously hung job from my
tests. The files and directory has the LSF JobID as suffix. Inside the
directories, there are stack trace of this executable and JSM processes
(obtained using `gstack`).

These jobs have a large input deck so unfortunately cannot attach them here but please let us know if you need additional information.

SUBJECT: CDC for z/OS CPU/storage use
DESCRIPTION:
Hi IBM,

We are planning to deploy CDC for z/OS in our production environment and for this reason we need to understand its potential MIPS use requirements. We're currently running various tests to asses that, but while this is being done could you please answer the following questions:

1) With IFI cache enabled, how does CDC fetch log data into the IFI cache? Is it being done continuously via IFI 306, and then also explicitly when requested log data is missing from IFI cache (another IFI 306 call)? 

2) Is the storage for IFI cache allocated in CDC's or DB2's address space ?

3) Does CDC read log data of all objects enabled for replication in Db2 data sharing group? We have Qrep capture running for the same Db2 datasharing group, so I wonder, will CDC have to first read all log records (and only then see if they should become part of any commit group) of all the objects defined with DATA CAPTURE CHANGES (whether it was done for Qrep or CDC) even if these objects are not defined in any CDC subscription?

4) How does CDC use filtering functionality provided with apar PM90568?

Thanks
Ziemo

SUBJECT: file timestamp problem since summer time switch
DESCRIPTION:
Hello,
since the time has changed to summer time, our developers found a problem with the date. Here is their explanation :
 When we issue a Resolve on the GUI, in FTM is created a Command PT (first screen ScreenPT.jpg) that contains a Command Transaction (second screen ScreenTxn.jpg).
To process the command, FTM read the values in the command transaction and starts an action (that is a piece of code).
In this piece of codes there is a new check (for 3.2) that fails and is logged in the Command Transaction Error log (third screen ScreenError.jpg).
Since there is this error, the Transaction goes to failed status and the original Resolve command is not processed.

Now, the error in the screen is misleading cause in \"actual\" and \"expected\" is printed the value of the same variable,  by the way the difference from the 2 timestamp that are checked is 1 hour.
The screen is important to IBM just to show that there's and error and is in that part of code.

The error, as said, happened only when we changed to summer time.

This is tests after a migration to IIB v10.0.0.16 + FTM v3.2.2.1

I join the 3 screenshots we talked above, and the joblog of broker and execution group.
No message in either log....
Regards,
Seave Ifteally

SUBJECT: PowerHA cluster networking issue caused kernel panic on healthy site
DESCRIPTION:
Two site stretched PowerHA clusters. Second site (DC2) having networking problems. Last night we moved resource groups to primary site (DC1). Overnight both clusters triggered DMZ at primary site and failed resource groups back to DC2. We have network and SAN heartbeat methods, and PowerHA had no reason to fail the RG to the site with the bad network.

Timeline:

 - Curesportelloccouppontuditutionfoondayeall, Finesch comms on the Dev and Test
   VLANs are problematic

 - Apr 15 ~19:00 : We spend more time to determine the connection issue is
   isolated to Dev and Test VLANs

 - Apr 15: ~21:00 : Test cluster moves RG from DC2 to DC1 to facilitate Kredinor
   scheduled application release

 - Apr 15: ~23:00 : Dev cluster moves RG from DC2 to DC1 to avoid problems in
   the mroning

 - Efervedevestaborsommucelevinseenitudierelthonclasuato, Ideas over to
   DC2. Networking still a problem at DC2, users cannot reach system.

 - Famottenctializediftecinveridevichalopplairectuaradmil, Eyest over to
   DC2. Network still a problem at DC2, users cannot reach system.

 - Apr 16: 08:30 : Healthcheck and review systems

 - Apr 16: ~09:00 : Stopped Dev and Test clusters at DC2

 - Apr 16: ~09:30 : Started Dev and Test clusters at DC1 ONLY. DC2 nodes are
   booted but clustering offline while we troubleshoot. Requested Bent (DBA)
   healthcheck Dev and Test DB's and perform a data integrity scan.

SUBJECT: SMPI: job crash when using 4000 nodes and 128k processes
DESCRIPTION:
Hello, 
We are seeing a weird issue on Summit that is preventing a code from running 128,000 tasks on 4,000 nodes with 32 processes per node. The code seems to be crashing in `pmix_ds21_is_invalid ()` even for a helloworld. I tried collecting additional debug information but so far haven't been able to gather any other logs with the standard variables. I do have a core file which shows the following:

(gdb) bt
#0  0x00002000013336f0 in pmix_ds21_is_invalid ()
   from /autofs/nccs-svm1_sw/summit/.swci/1-compute/opt/spack/20180914/linux-rhel7-ppc64le/gcc-4.8.5/spectrum-mpi-10.3.1.2-20200121-tvzx7uja3kmwouk4uzfem5ttugc6bkiz/container/../lib/pmix/mca_gds_ds21.so
#1  0x00002000013d8b20 in _dstore_fetch ()
   from /autofs/nccs-svm1_sw/summit/.swci/1-compute/opt/spack/20180914/linux-rhel7-ppc64le/gcc-4.8.5/spectrum-mpi-10.3.1.2-20200121-tvzx7uja3kmwouk4uzfem5ttugc6bkiz/container/../lib/libmca_common_dstore.so.1
#2  0x00002000013dc9c8 in pmix_common_dstor_fetch ()
   from /autofs/nccs-svm1_sw/summit/.swci/1-compute/opt/spack/20180914/linux-rhel7-ppc64le/gcc-4.8.5/spectrum-mpi-10.3.1.2-20200121-tvzx7uja3kmwouk4uzfem5ttugc6bkiz/container/../lib/libmca_common_dstore.so.1
#3  0x0000200001332270 in ds21_fetch ()
   from /autofs/nccs-svm1_sw/summit/.swci/1-compute/opt/spack/20180914/linux-rhel7-ppc64le/gcc-4.8.5/spectrum-mpi-10.3.1.2-20200121-tvzx7uja3kmwouk4uzfem5ttugc6bkiz/container/../lib/pmix/mca_gds_ds21.so
#4  0x0000200001466c58 in resolve_peers ()
   from /autofs/nccs-svm1_sw/summit/.swci/1-compute/opt/spack/20180914/linux-rhel7-ppc64le/gcc-4.8.5/spectrum-mpi-10.3.1.2-20200121-tvzx7uja3kmwouk4uzfem5ttugc6bkiz/container/../lib/pmix/mca_preg_native.so
#5  0x00002000011cdc10 in pmix_preg_base_resolve_peers ()
   from /autofs/nccs-svm1_sw/summit/.swci/1-compute/opt/spack/20180914/linux-rhel7-ppc64le/gcc-4.8.5/spectrum-mpi-10.3.1.2-20200121-tvzx7uja3kmwouk4uzfem5ttugc6bkiz/container/../lib/libpmix.so.2
#6  0x0000200001114d08 in _resolve_peers ()
   from /autofs/nccs-svm1_sw/summit/.swci/1-compute/opt/spack/20180914/linux-rhel7-ppc64le/gcc-4.8.5/spectrum-mpi-10.3.1.2-20200121-tvzx7uja3kmwouk4uzfem5ttugc6bkiz/container/../lib/libpmix.so.2
#7  0x000020000090b918 in event_process_active_single_queue (base=0x35771b10, activeq=0x35771fe0, max_to_process=9999999999, endtime=0x0) at event.c:1646
#8  0x000020000090c404 in event_process_active (base=0x35771b10) at event.c:1738
#9  event_base_loop (base=0x35771b10, flags=<optimized out>) at event.c:1961
#10 0x0000200001171c6c in progress_engine ()
   from /autofs/nccs-svm1_sw/summit/.swci/1-compute/opt/spack/20180914/linux-rhel7-ppc64le/gcc-4.8.5/spectrum-mpi-10.3.1.2-20200121-tvzx7uja3kmwouk4uzfem5ttugc6bkiz/container/../lib/libpmix.so.2
#11 0x00002000002b8b94 in start_thread () from /lib64/libpthread.so.0
#12 0x00002000004185f4 in clone () from /lib64/libc.so.6

This is using SMPI 10.3.1.2 and it is just a simple MPI code.

Do you have suggestions on what could be causing the crash and how to workaround it?

It is 100% reproducible using this jsrun command:
jsrun --nrs 8000 --rs_per_host 2 --tasks_per_rs 16 --cpu_per_rs 21 ./hello_mpi_SMPI

Weirdly, I can run more tasks in fewer nodes without hitting the issue so it seems to be something related to the specific layout.

Best,
Vernica

SUBJECT: INSERT INTO ROB_TEST.XMLTEST (SELECT * FROM WC_VIRAL.TVEYES_COMBINED)
DESCRIPTION:
When duplicating a row based table like this it hangs the row engine, I have been working with Dra Fiennig from IBM on this issue and he believes its a bug.

The table as two 128 varchar and a xml type variable

First I create a table
create table rob.xmltest like wc_viral.tveyes_combined 
organize on row
distribute on random;

Then I insert the data from the one table to the other.  The intent is to fix a bad distribution on the original table that causes slow backups.

INSERT INTO ROB_TEST.XMLTEST (SELECT * FROM WC_VIRAL.TVEYES_COMBINED)

Dan has tested this using a limit  and it works ok. When he ups the number of records it hangs the engine.

SUBJECT: PowerSC GUI Server V1.2.0.2 disables WebLogic access to Oracle Database
DESCRIPTION:
We are working to Migrate from Power 8 System to Power 9 Servers. At the old platform P8 has an Oracle RAC DB which has WebLogic clients connecting to DB instance. The Brand new P9 platform has AIX 7.2 and Oracle DB configured to provide same service and PowerSC as Hardening over OS AIX 7.2. When the operation was switched to P9 some WebLogic clients has unsuccessful access to the Oracle DB. So in order to isolate this problem, through the PowerSC's Console we rolledback profile definition (undo) to the DB Server and the connections from WebLogic Clients was most of them successfully restored. Please advice in order to know how PowerSC could change clients access.
From PowerSC side it was applied PCIv3.xml profile.
By now teres no system down, but this is very important to migrate from obsolete P8 to brand new P9 platform.
Please if you request to gather files or logs, just tell us. Thanks!

SUBJECT: Datenbankabbrche IBM i
DESCRIPTION:
Sehr geehrte Damen und Herren,
zwischen unseren IIS Servern und der IBM i Datenbank treten in unregelmiger Reihenfolge Abbrche der ODBC Verbindungen auf.

SUBJECT: Out of sequence read of a mix of persistent and non-persistent messages
DESCRIPTION:
In very rare occasions, a mix of persistent and non-persistent messages is read out of sequence.

The scenario is the following:

1.	Local queue Q1 is defined with Message Delivery Sequence=Priority and Default Priority=5.
2.	Batch job P1 puts several non-persistent messages (1-10) to local queue Q1 via alias A1 with priority=AQD.
3.	Batch job P1 puts one persistent message to the same local queue Q1 via the same alias A1 with priority=AQD.
4.	A commit is issued to RRS.
5.	Queue Q1 is consumed via alias A1 by process P2. In 99.999% of cases the non-persistent messages are read, as expected, before the persistent message.
But in some rare occurrences, the messages are read out of sequence, the persistent message is read before the non-persistent one.

We know that internally MQ has two sets of sub-queues, one for persistent messages, and another one for non-persistent messages.
But our understanding is that, under these conditions, the message sequence should be guaranteed. Nowhere in the documentation we found any restriction for the guaranteed sequence of a mix of persistent and non-persistent messages.


Important information:

	Q1 is a local queue with priority
	All messages have the same priority
	Mix of persistent and non-persistent messages
	Only 1 putter and 1 getter process involved
	All messages under syncpoint
	RRS as resource coordinator
	MQ V9.0 LTS

Makedef of the queue and alias:

* COMMANDS GENERATED FOR CSY3                                                   
DEFINE NOREPLACE                                                       -        
 QLOCAL('P.SU.MQDR.UPOSITIONING.INP.01')                               -        
 QSGDISP(QMGR)                                                         -        
 STGCLASS('STGUPS13')                                                  -        
 CFSTRUCT(' ')                                                         -        
 CLUSTER(' ')                                                          -        
 CLUSNL(' ')                                                           -        
 DESCR('INPUT QUEUE FOR POSITIONING')                                  -        
 PUT(ENABLED)                                                          -        
 DEFPRTY(5)                                                            -        
 DEFPSIST(YES)                                                         -        
 MAXDEPTH(156000)                                                      -        
 PROCESS(' ')                                                          -        
 NOTRIGGER                                                             -        
 MAXMSGL(4194304)                                                      -        
 BOTHRESH(0)                                                           -        
 BOQNAME(' ')                                                          -        
 INITQ(' ')                                                            -        
 USAGE(NORMAL)                                                         -        
 SHARE                                                                 -        
 DEFSOPT(SHARED)                                                       -

SUBJECT: Log Forwarder exit not working
DESCRIPTION:
Hello,

We have 4 z/OS LPARs on our Production environment and all of them has IBM OPerations Analytics for z installed and running. On each LPAR, HBOPROC and HBODSPRO address space are started and running. 

From the HBOPROC joblog, version info is as follows,

Version: V2R1M0          
Build ID: 20191104-0803  
APAR: OA58626            

From the IOAz web gui interface, version is : IBM Operations Analytics -Log Analysis 1.3.5.0 -Standard Edition

Our z/OS version is v2.2
Today, without no apparent reason, HBOPROC address space on SYSB LPAR started use excessive CPU. 
From RMF mon-III, its CPU consumption went up to %100 eappl and continued that way. (all usage was on general purpose processor no zIIP was being used) Recycling the HBOPROC along with HBODSPRO did not help. 
There were no error or any other messages on the joblog for an indication of the high CPU usage. 
So, we first took an SVC dump of both HBOPROC and HBODSPRO and then close HBOPROC temporarily. 
HBOPROC and HBODSPRO address spaces on the other LPARs are running fine. 
 I'm uploading the joblog of HBOPROC from SYSB and the SVC dump.
Can you please take a look and let us know the reason of this highCPU usage and how to solve it? 
It is a little urgent as we can't have it running this way and stopping it impacts our log analysis capability. 
Please let us know if any additional data is needed. 

Regards,
Alper

SUBJECT: z/OS Explorer validation done using old Security profiles
DESCRIPTION:
Using IBM Explorer for z/OS v3.1.1.23 in combination with IBM z/OS Explorer Extensions v14.2.1.0, after changing the ACF2 profile of a user a mix of the old and new profile are used by z/OS Explorer for validation. This causes security violations even though the new profile does have access.

Steps we used to reproduce this issue:
1) create test user with profile IINMDSNO
2) log on to z/OS Explorer, the log off again
3) change the ACF2 profile of the test user to IINMDZOS
4) log on again to the same z/OS Explorer server, when accessing a dataset to which the new profile has access we get a dataset violation for the old profile

We tried clearing the security cache of the OMVS processes after changing the profile but the issue still appeared.
This appears to be related to the security cache of z/OS Explorer.

I have included a zip with following files:
- Shoredinalusialmothrottissennecatealteesse, Ide the rsecomm log for the test user
- the RSED joblog
- a word doc with an example of the issue and screenshots

Is there some action we need to take for z/OS Explorer when we change security resources? And if yes, how can this apparent cache be refreshed?

SUBJECT: Mail server problems after updating to AIX 7200-04-01-1939
DESCRIPTION:
Since updating an AIX LPAR from 7200-03-03 to 7200-04-01 we have been experiencing multiple sendmail-related problems.  This is even after applying the  IJ24059m1a efix.
 
 On the handful of AIX LPARs that have been updated *ALL* of them have had their /etc/mail/aliases file disappear.  Mailing problems on several LPARs were corrected after restoring that file and running the \"newaliases\" command, with mail flowing once again for all but one of the LPARs and getting directed to our Domino server for distribution. (Note: All these LPARs have an identical senmail.cf file with the Domino server specified on the \"DS\" line.)
  
However, we continue to have sendmail problems on our most recently updated LPAR, where even though it has the identical sendmail.cf file as the other LPARs does not direct the mail to be handled by the server specified on the \"DS\" line, and continually only uses its own mail facility.  The aliases file has been restored to this box, and the above-referenced efix in installed. 

I am uploading to you a comparison of two nodes - the failing one and one that works.  I will also upload the sendmail.cf file that is the same on both these nodes.  Please let me know if there are any other efixes I need to install or what else I need to do to get mail working correctly on the problem node.  The problem is directly related to the AIX update work performed last Thursday.
Thanks,
 --Mark

SUBJECT: Unnumber is extremely slow
DESCRIPTION:
With IDz 14.1.7.1, when doing \"Source > Sequence Numbers > Unnumber\" on a big Cobol source file (11500 lines), IDz becomes unresponsive for a very long time and must be forcibly closed.

From the stackdump and analysis under the debugger, it looks to me like IDz is doing a replace operation for each line, one by one, with an offset increasing by 82 each time and a length of 8 for each replace. Each individual replace appears to be triggering a source modified event and reconciliation between the source buffer and the syntax representation, which would explain why it is so extremely slow to remove a bunch of line numbers.

On my machine I measured about 350 ms per line, so on this Cobol file which is 11,500 lines it would probably take over an hour if I let it finish (I killed it before that).

SUBJECT: SETPROG command syntax
DESCRIPTION:
Hello, 

I have a question about the SETPROG EXIT command syntax.
If I ever update the attributes of an EXIT via the setprog command, how can I take this change back again? 

In the following link, it states that default bahaviour is is not to perform KEEPRC processing:
https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSLTBW_2.1.0/com.ibm.zos.v2r1.ieag100/saexit.htm 

So if I modify the default behaviour, using a command such as given below, how can I take this modification back to original, dynamically? 

SETPROG,EXIT,ATTRIB,EXITNAME(SYS.IEFUTL),KEEPRC(GT,0)

SUBJECT: Application using MQ seeing failures in receiving responses.
DESCRIPTION:
Hello,

We are seeing this Production issue with one of the application who uses MQ.

ESB(Application Name on AIX) via MQ sends requests to AMS (Destination Application Name on Mainframes) .

AMS process them and sends response back to ESB .

All this Messages transfer happens via MQ.

So the ESB application seeing timeouts every now and then.

Here timeouts in the sense, ESB application expects to receive AMS response with in 30 seconds and when they don't receive they timeout and ignore the response if it comes after 30 sec.

According to AMS logs they are responding in time.

Network team confirmed all good between the MQ Servers.

I am looking for below information:

On ESB Unix MQ would like to see the amount of time the response message was on the queue before ESB application consumed it. Also can I go back in history say 2 days back and grab this kind of information. Without capturing MQ trace is there any way I can get this kind of information.

Thanks
Difiet Asesigh

pstack.apply.out ->  pstack  < replication pid>

db2pd_appinfo.txt -> db2pd -apinfo

SUBJECT: PGI: pgc++ 19.10 optimization bug (-fast or -O3 -Mautoinline)
DESCRIPTION:
Hello, we have a Summit user who writes:

There seems to be a problem with the compiler optimizer  in pgc++ 19.10  related to optimization -fast (which uses  -Mautoinline).

I have attached a simple test code (see autoinline_bug.tar).

To compile and run the code, perform

sh show_bug.sh

The max_err should be around 1e-9.

Using \"-fast\" or \"-O3 -Mautoinline\" will give incorrect results.

Using \"-O1 -Mautoinline\" will give expected result.

This problem is with pgc++ 19.10 on summit and also on   x86 Linux. Would you kindly look into this issue?

SUBJECT: MQ z/OS: DLQ handler: processing specific messages on DLQ
DESCRIPTION:
Dear Sir or Madam,

WAS (Websphere Application Server) puts messages to DLQ (the Dead Letter Queue) of a QM (Queue Manager) on z/OS.
The reasons of doing that differ, for instance the error queue, which is used to put error messages, is initially full.
The MQ messages contain a RFH2 header. 



The DLQ is configured as follows:
QUEUE(QP22.DEAD.QUEUE)         
TYPE(QLOCAL)                   
QSGDISP(QMGR)                  
STGCLASS(PSID50)               
PSID(50)                       
CFSTRUCT( )                    
CLUSTER( )                     
CLUSNL( )                      
DESCR(QP22 dead-letter queue)  
PUT(ENABLED)                   
DEFPRTY(0)                     
DEFPSIST(YES)                  
OPPROCS(0)                     
IPPROCS(0)                     
CURDEPTH(6245)                 
MAXDEPTH(999999999)            
PROCESS( )                     
NOTRIGGER                      
MAXMSGL(104857600)             
BOTHRESH(0)         
BOQNAME( )          
INITQ( )            
USAGE(NORMAL)       
SHARE               
DEFSOPT(SHARED)     
MSGDLVSQ(FIFO)      
RETINTVL(999999999) 
TRIGTYPE(NONE)      
TRIGDPTH(1)         
TRIGMPRI(0)         
TRIGDATA( )         
DEFTYPE(PREDEFINED) 
NOHARDENBO          
CRDATE(2013-01-07)  
CRTIME(10.41.47)    
GET(ENABLED)        
DEFREADA(NO)        
DEFPRESP(SYNC)      
PROPCTL(COMPAT)     
QDEPTHHI(80)             
QDEPTHHI(80)        
QDEPTHLO(40)        
QDPMAXEV(ENABLED)   
QDPHIEV(DISABLED)   
QDPLOEV(DISABLED)

CLWLRANK(0)         
CLWLPRTY(0)         
CLWLUSEQ(QMGR)      
TPIPE(              
 )                  
CUSTOM( )           
CLCHNAME( )         

When our MQ admins try to proces these messages on a dead-letter queue
using the DLQ handler, the DLQ handler is invoked by submitting a JCL job (see uploaded DLQXDC.EBCDIC and DLQXDC.ASCII).

However the DLQ handler fails to process these messages 
and puts the messages back to DLQ with another reason code in the header 
than the original reason code.
The DLQ handler 
CSQU950I CSQUDLQ IBM MQ for z/OS V9.1.0                                 
CSQU200I CSQUDLQ Dead-letter Queue Handler Utility - 2020-01-20 11:04:12
CSQU201I Processing queue QP22.DEAD.QUEUE                               
CSQU211I Unable to put message, line 3 MQRC=2110 (MQRC_FORMAT_ERROR)    
CSQU211I Unable to put message, line 3 MQRC=2110 (MQRC_FORMAT_ERROR) 
<redundant CSQU211I lines are left out here>
CSQU202I Dead-letter queue handler ending. Successful actions: 0 retries, 0 forwards, 0 discards
CSQU203I 6245 messages remain on the dead-letter queue
See the entire uploaded xdc of the DLQ message processing by the DLQ handler in EBCDIC (the dataset DLQXDC.EBCDIC) 
and ASCII (the file DLQXDC.ASCII) format.
The entire output of the JCL job is included in the uploaded DLQXDC.EBCDIC and DLQXDC.ASCII.

I can upload the messages on the DLQ before and after the DLQ handler processing.
However they contain sensitive information. So I need first to know whether 
it is necessary. If so, should these data be uploaded in a different way than the usual data.
We collected this data using the q-utility in USS:
step 1) /u/a59g030/abasi00/mqbin/q -=300 -L10 -i QP12.DEAD.QUEUE -m QP12 -ddh3 > dlqdump
step 2) DLQ handler processing (see JCL job output in uploaded DLQXDC.EBCDIC and DLQXDC.ASCII).
step 3) /u/a59g030/abasi00/mqbin/q -=300 -L10 -i QP22.DEAD.QUEUE -m QP22 -ddh3 > dlqdump2 

How our MQ admins have to deal with processing these messages?

We'd like to be able to process the DLQ messages using the same DLQ handler procedure if possible.
We never had issues with processing the DLQ messages using the DLQ handler. 
It is the fi

SUBJECT: Monitor apar PH21858 OS Connect API toolkit data transformation function of PIC in PL/I not working
DESCRIPTION:
As per the documentation in knowledge center for PL/I to JSON transformation https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SS4SVW_3.0.0/designing/service_pli2json.html, 


PICTURE '999V99' should convert to

\"type\":\"number\",
\"description\":\"decimal\",
\"minimum\": 0,
\"maximum\": y,
\"multipleOf\": z

But in the API toolkit Service Interface Editor, the PIC '99999' is getting transformed to CHAR (5). We would like the transformation of PIC to Decimal. 

Checked the cases in zos connect forum and response we received:

\"This appears to be a defect in the import process for PL/I. 
As long as the picture string consists of S, 9, and V characters we should be treating it as zoned decimal (as is done for COBOL USAGE DISPLAY).\"

API Toolkit version we use is 3.0.6.4.

Thanks,

SUBJECT: Domino server keeps approaching a system limit - # of message keys in a job
DESCRIPTION:
For over the last year, one of the Lotus Domino servers at VEKA keeps approaching a system limit - # of message keys in a job. 
When you hit this limit the job stops and the Domino server needs to be restarted. 
He has been keeping track of it and then doing a scheduled restart when it starts to get too high. 
Domino got sold by IBM to a company called HCL and HCL has not been able to do much about it so far. 

We found out that IBM i will dump a VLOG when the job is at 50%, 75%, and 90% of the limit, but there's not much of interest in those.  
When slic is about to hit the limit, it also cuts VLOGs for the last few messages that have the program stacks.  

However, Christian restarts the job before the stacks are dumped because they need to have planned downtime, not unplanned.

So... we talked to a developer here (Jush Larregionsta) and she agreed to make a PTF that will dump some stacks to the vlog when the 50%, 75% and 90% levels are reached.
In this way, we will get several stacks from that job as it is using message keys, but will still allow him to restart the job in a planned way before it crashes. 
We suspect that a lot of the stacks will be the same - and that will tell us (or HCL) what code is using all the keys.

So, we'd like to open a case, and an apar for Anna to use for the PTF.  She is in EX QSPACE - for CPS it is the Internals queue.   
She'll make a PTF, then when VEKA gets the VLOGS they would send them in via the case so she can make sure that everything is ok with the vlog output. 
VEKA would then share the stacks with HCL.

SUBJECT: Channel authentication records hostname resolving issue
DESCRIPTION:
Hi IBM, 

we are encountering issues when configuring channel authentication records with a hostname in the 'ADDRESS' property. It seems as if the reverse lookup for hostnames in channel authentication records is not working as expected. Only when we configure the rule with an IP it is working. 
The 'REVDNS' property is enabled at the queue manager level and I can also confirm that a dns server is configured on the host system. 
Also, our cluster sender and cluster receiver channels are configured with a hostname inside the 'CONNAME' property and the clustering setup is working fine so i would think MQ is able to do reverse lookups. 

To demonstrate this I have configured an 'ADDRESSMAP' channel authentication record with a hostname: 

SET CHLAUTH('CL.MOM.ADMIN') TYPE(ADDRESSMAP) ADDRESS('s1106872.servers.kbca.be') USERSRC(MAP) MCAUSER('JSD9901') ACTION(REPLACE)


With the amqsputc sample I tried to open a queue on queue manager SMTA over the above mentioned channel: 

$ amqsputc KBC.DELETED.Q08 SMTA
Sample AMQSPUT0 start
target queue is KBC.DELETED.Q08
MQOPEN ended with reason code 2035
unable to open queue for output
Sample AMQSPUT0 end


output in queue manager log: 

+CSQX511I SMTA CSQXRESP Channel CL.MOM.ADMIN started 788                
 connection 10.152.33.13                                                
ICH408I USER(NOACCESS) GROUP(        ) NAME(???                 ) 789   
  LOGON/JOB INITIATION - USER AT TERMINAL          NOT RACF-DEFINED     
IRR012I  VERIFICATION FAILED. USER PROFILE NOT FOUND.                   
+CSQX512I SMTA CSQXRESP Channel CL.MOM.ADMIN no longer active 

The reason why we are seeing user 'NOACCESS' is because we have 'NOACCESS' set as the mcauser value in the channel definition. Usually if there is a matching channel authentication record the mcauser value of the channel is overwritten by the mcauser value defined by the channel authentication record but here it clearly isn't working as expected. 

But then if we configure the same channel authentication record with an IP instead of hostname, it works perfectly and the mapping to the authorized user is applied: 

SET CHLAUTH('CL.MOM.ADMIN') TYPE(ADDRESSMAP) ADDRESS('10.152.33.13') USERSRC(MAP) MCAUSER('JSD9901') ACTION(REPLACE)

$ amqsputc KBC.DELETED.Q08
Sample AMQSPUT0 start
target queue is KBC.DELETED.Q08
Test message

Sample AMQSPUT0 end

SMTA DIS CHS(CL.MOM.ADMIN)                                           
CSQM293I SMTA CSQMDRTC 1 CHSTATUS FOUND MATCHING REQUEST CRITERIA        
CSQM201I SMTA CSQMDRTC  DIS CHSTATUS DETAILS                             
CHSTATUS(CL.MOM.ADMIN)                                                   
CHLDISP(PRIVATE)                                                         
CONNAME(10.152.33.13)                                                    
STATUS(RUNNING)                                                                    
CHLTYPE(SVRCONN)                                                                                                                               
QMNAME(SMTA)                                                             
RAPPLTAG(amqsputc)                                                                                                                 
RPRODUCT(MQCC)                                                                                                              
MCAUSER(JSD9901)      

Could you please assist us in determining why the mapping with hostname is not working as expected and how to resolve it? 

Kind regards, 
Stijn De Schutter

SUBJECT: Asynchronous duplexing processing stalled for DB2 lock structure
DESCRIPTION:
We are migrating from Infiniband Coupling links to Coupling Express LR links. We have started the process on our Corporate Bank sysplex, without issues. 

As part of this process we activated a new IODF last night that removed some of the Infiniband links on our Retail Bank sysplex and that introduced replacement CE LR links. 

When we did the hardware activate on the first processor we experienced a stall in a DB2 lock structure set-up for asynchronous duplexing. This resulted in an XCF dump and generated non-disruptive dumps of the two ICFs that hold the duplexed lock structure. 

We experienced a spike in response times until the asynchronous duplexing was recovered (automatically).

Additionally, the processors called home to IBM. As a result we have a hardware call open with IBM. They have highlighted a potential MCL fix, although it is not clear yet whether this will fix the stall, the non-disruptive dumps or both.

Hardware call details:-

pmh 63265,019,866 2964 83-2A2CA - ZF1                         
pmh 63266,019,866 2964 83-2A49A - ZF2

MCL fix - P08416.009 bundle S89 (11/12/2019)

Procedure used for activation of IODF 

1) Configure offline all CIB channels that will be deleted by activation of IODF61. On both ZF1 83-2A2CA and ZF2 83-2A49A, for all z/OS and ICF lpars;
2) On ZF1 activate, using HCD option 2.6.2, Activate software configuration only. Validate hardware changes. Process changes to functions and Coupling Facility elements on all z/OS lpars bar one;
3) On the remaining z/OS lpar on ZF1, do a Hardware and Software activate to complete activation;

For 2) and 3) a test activate was performed first, prior to the actual activates.

After 3) we experienced the issue we are reporting. 

Once the response times recovered, we proceeded with the activation on ZF2. We experienced no issues with this.

Following this we successfully configured online the new Coupling Express LR links.

Further Details
-----------------

We activated IODF61, which did the following:-
1) Removed 4 of 8 CIB links between ZF1 z/OS lpars and ICFRET2 on ZF2;
2) Removed 4 of 8 CIB links between ZF1 ICFRET1 and z/OS lpars on ZF2;
3) Removed 2 of 4 CIB links between ZF1 ICFRET1 and ZF2 ICFRET2;
4) Added in the same number of CL5 links to replace the CIB links removed in 1) to 3).

I will upload the XCF dump taken and the syslog from the timeframe shortly. Let me know if you would like any further diagnostics.

Can you let us know if there are any z/OS issues or actions that we should be aware of?

Thanks,
Dave.

SUBJECT: C++ locales fehlerhaft
DESCRIPTION:
Die locales unter C++ funktionieren nicht wie erwartet. Wie im Beispielprogramm gezeigt, ndern sich die Eigenschaften wie Dezimalzeichen und Whrungszeichen zwischen DE_DE und EN_US nicht. Dies ist z.B. problematisch bei der Umsetzung von Strings mittels iostream nach Dezimalzahlen und umgekehrt (am Bespiel ostringstream gezeigt). C locales funktionieren wie erwartet. Getestet mit IBM i 7.2, 7.3 und 7.4.

Beispielprogramm TSTLOC
Erstellung:
CRTCPPMOD MODULE(QTEMP/TSTLOC) SRCSTMF('locale.cpp') DBGVIEW(*ALL) OPTION(*STDLOGMSG *RTTIALL *SHOWUSR) DFTCHAR(*UNSIGNED) TGTCCSID(1141) LANGLVL(*EXTENDED0X) LOCALETYPE(*LOCALEUCS2) TERASPACE(*YES *TSIFC) OPTIMIZE(10) STGMDL(*INHERIT)

CRTPGM PGM(QTEMP/TSTLOC) ACTGRP(*NEW)

Ausfhrung:
CALL PGM(QTEMP/TSTLOC)

Ausgabe:
**** C++ locales ****
C / decimal point  : .
C / thousands_sep  : ,
C / currency symbol: EUR
/QSYS.LIB/DE_DE.LOCALE / decimal point  : .
/QSYS.LIB/DE_DE.LOCALE / thousands_sep  : ,
/QSYS.LIB/DE_DE.LOCALE / currency symbol: EUR
/QSYS.LIB/EN_US.LOCALE / decimal point  : .
/QSYS.LIB/EN_US.LOCALE / thousands_sep  : ,
/QSYS.LIB/EN_US.LOCALE / currency symbol: EUR
DE_DE: -3.4e-05 / expected: -3,4e-05
EN_US: -3.4e-05 / expected: -3.4e-05

**** C locales ****
/QSYS.LIB/DE_DE.LOCALE,,,,,,,/QSYS.LIB/QLGPGCMA2.LOCALE,,,,,,, / decimal point  : ,
/QSYS.LIB/DE_DE.LOCALE,,,,,,,/QSYS.LIB/QLGPGCMA2.LOCALE,,,,,,, / thousands_sep  : .
/QSYS.LIB/DE_DE.LOCALE,,,,,,,/QSYS.LIB/QLGPGCMA2.LOCALE,,,,,,, / currency symbol: -

SUBJECT: Slow boot of VIO servers
DESCRIPTION:
We had our quarterly outage over the weekend where part of the maintenance is to reboot all of the VIO servers.  No issues with our production environment however when I went to reboot our Dev VIO servers, (two per each 870 setup for failover)  it took each server over two hours to come back online.  It looks most of the time was spent doing the discovery of the SAN storage with cfgmgr.  All of the devices are VSCSI devices presented back to the client LPARs to be boot devices.  We do the same reboot maintenance every quarter and did not have any issues back in November.  The Dev environment sits on different
SAN storage then production.  I had the SAN team check for errors and they did not see anything on the SAN side.

SUBJECT: Need help identifing jobs waiting for locks
DESCRIPTION:
For the past month or so, a couple of times a day, only during business hours, our application experiences long delays.  SQL select statement that normally take much less than 1 second suddenly start taking over 30 seconds, sometimes minutes.  The times these delays occur correspond to the large green bars on the attached file, so it's likely to be some kind of locking issue.  The attached graph (feb27-record-locks) was produced using IBM Navigator for i.  We're unsure if these delays / locks are related to application changes, or something else in our environment.

We need help to:
1)  Break down the record lock wait time by individual job.
2) Identify which locked records the job is waiting on.
3) Identify the job which is locking those records.

SUBJECT: LSF reservation to capture new nodes
DESCRIPTION:
This is likely a feature request, but I am hoping some mechanism might already exist to accomplish this task.  When putting an advance reservation in place (typically for maintenance), all nodes are never up in a system the size of Summit.  However, before the reservation becomes active, nodes will likely recover but are not added to the reservation.  Is there a mechanism to allow a reservation to dynamically add nodes from a group (say compute in our case) as they become available?  We are accustomed to this feature in both Moab and SLURM.

Thanks,
Don

SUBJECT: Java unable to get MAC address to support 3rd party product
DESCRIPTION:
Help System's GoAnywhere fails on start up because it is unable to get the mac address for its license check.  We have been working with Help Systems and they referred us to IBM support as this is a known bug with Java.  I'm pasting their notes they have on the issue below.  I reviewed their notes and our Java group PTF is much newer than listed so I would think we have the PTF.  Something they couldn't answer for me is if this is because we are running Virtual IP.  Any suggestions for next step is appreciated.  Thanks.

The iSeries is a Virtual Server.  IBM has provided a workaround that we can discuss with the customer, but it is not a good idea to offer it as a solution as their configuration may be different and this should come from IBM.  See case 35409.
The iSeries is using multiple network interface cards (NICs) and is using Link Aggregation.  This was voluntarily disabled to resolve case 37978.  It was reported to development, but I have not seen a response.
Case 38797 is still open and the cause is yet unknown for sure, but the customer has the system configured to use a virtual MAC instead of the actual MAC and this appears to be the issue. 
 
NOTE:  A Solaris server with no MAC address was reported in case 36710.  Development says this issue has been resolved in version 5.2.1 but customers should upgrade to the latest version.
NOTE:  I have seen one issue with a potential customer running on a hosted Linux on a VM and it was decided by the host company that it would not be possible for GA to get the MAC.  I haven't found the case number yet.

From IBM (Case 38518):

\"This issue we will fix it in the 6.0, 6.2.6,70.7.1 and 8.0 32bit and 64bit at all IBM i OS VRMs in the CR16_02, the schedule of CR16_02 is at the end of June , The PTFs will be included in following group ptfs:
IBM i 6.1 OS : SF99562 level:36
IBM i 7.1 OS : SF99572 level:25
IBM i 7.2 OS : SF99716 level:10
IBM i 7.3 OS : SF99725 level:2\"
Fix for 7.1 JDK60 32-bit is PTF SI60245


Since I have confirmed the fix will be included in the next IBM i Java Group PTF due out at the end of June and your current issue is resolved, would it be ok to close the PMR at this time? 
 
ENVIRONMENT                                                            
===========                                                             
IBM i 7.1                                                              
SF99572 - 24 - installed                                               
JDK 6.0 32bit                                                          
                                                                        
PROBLEM                                                                
=======                                                                
GoAnyWhere Linoma Java application is failing to successfully retrieve 
the IBM i ethernet MAC addresses using JDK 6.0 32bit.                  
                                                                        
BUSINESS IMPACT                                                        
===============                                                        
High - critical application they need to get working.                  
                                                                        
ACTION TAKEN                                                            
============                                                           
The issue occurred after applying the latest IBM i CUM/Java Group PTFs.
After reviewing the problem description, I believe this issue is a match
to CPS DI # A7EUER.  TEST PTF SI60245 is available for the 6.0 32bit   
JDK.

SUBJECT: DFSUPAA0 - unreleased storage
DESCRIPTION:
We use a self written REXX Framework to install and activate PSB, MFS and Programs as whole packages into running IMS systems.
To install MFS we call DFSUPAA0 and DFSUNUB0 out of a REXX program. Each call of DFSUPAA0 results in 140K of unreleased storage. To enclose the problem we separated the call of DFSUPAA0 in a simple REXX. The virtual storage usage can be found in JOBOUT.ICMOIMFS at line 490. 
In the SVC Dump we found data in these storages areas written by DFSUPAA0 to 'SYSTEXT  DD  DSN=&&TXTPASS'. It seems to be used by DFSUNUB0 but will never be released.

SUBJECT: Ldap errors when Nessus can runs on IBM i
DESCRIPTION:
I previously opened TS003026047 because users that used Kerberos (SSO) couldn't connect to IBM I systems at version V7R2 and V7R3 and every time in the job log we noticed GLD0117 error in QUSRDIR joblog.  We bounced ldap and the users were able to connect.  This error occurs on the 15th of every month and we determined it is when security team runs the Nessus scan.  The error occurs in QUSRDIR every time the scan runs on all systems, but one or two systems SSO works and the others don't.  

Today we had a triage with the security team trying to figure out what Nessus is running that is causing the problem and we could not recreate the issue where we could not log on using SSO, but every time QUSRDIR received and GLD0113 error.   The Nessus version : 8.9.0
Plugin feed version : 202003060110.

The first time we removed user authentication part of the scan., then removed GP policy, then removed ports 389 and 636 from the scan, scanned only port 21, then removed all ports and they all caused the error.   We then tried the same scans using Nessus defaults. All caused error.  I then tried changing ibm-slapdDbConnections from 4 to 10 has Jared mentioned in previous case, but same results.

We then tried running nmap for port 636 then again for ports listed in the attachment, but had same results. ran a nmap IP addresses and it still caused error.

Each time we were able to log on using SSO.  We believe these errors should  not be occurring and do not know if its contributing to the SSO problem.  Another scan will be occurring on 3/15 and was hoping to get additional information.

subject:
The hdisks in the other profile are recognized.
.
description:
This environment has two different profiles created in 1LPARs.
 - SchrievishinsibervelsonfounteloOrlainig, we are using this profile.
 - profileB: nishikatsu.       <- This profile is being used as a test environment.

.
Customers can switch between nishikatsu and saitai by work.
 - Both environments are the same as the hostname and IP address.
 - Both environments are NPIV configurations.
 - Saitai's hdisk is a volume copy of a hdisk of Nishikatsu.
   so, VG-Name and PVID are the same.
 - The two environments are zoned to different LUNs.
   The physical disks used for each profile are different.
   It is implemented by setting different WWPN in vfcs of the VIOC.
.
The customer has activated the node with Nishikatsu for testing.
After the test,the customer switched the profile and activated Saitai.
Normally, this environment is hdisk0-95.
However, additional hdisk96-125 was displayed.
.
hdisk96-125 is the disk of Nishikatsu.
The customer has checked the ODM, WWPN, WWNN, but was successfully changed.
.
This problem is a rare occurrence.
This problem has been recovered in the following method:
1)# rmdev -dl [hdisk96-125]
2)shutdown -F
3)Activate LPAR from HMC with ProfileA:Saitai.
.

SUBJECT: QWHS_MOD_LVL not filled in in Db2 type 100 SMF data
DESCRIPTION:
Hi, we had an issue of mainview processing SMF statistics (type 100) for Db2 records due to some corrupted records. It was investigated by BMC and they saw in SMF data 10 currupted entries. (case 00837744). As attachement, you'll find a word document with detail from the BMC investigation.
The problem disappeared the next day. We would like to know the problem, so we can avoid reoccurance. 

Hereby the short feedback from BMC:

There were 10 corrupted entries in DSN=BMCCS.C0837744.SMFSSKC
From these I observed the following IFCIDs (all statistics)

IFCID FREQUENCY DESCRIPTION
0001 02 System Service Stats
0002 02 Database Stats
0202 02 System Parameters (from Stats)
0230 02 Data Sharing Global Stats
0225 02 System Storage (from Stats)

These were in series as follows:

0001, 0002, 0202, 0230, 0225 <== all corrupted QWHS
0003 - ACCOUNTING Record which was completely intact
0001, 0002, 0202, 0230, 0225 <== all corrupted QWHS

Regarding the time.
The QWHS Store-Clock value for the first corrupted record (IFCID 0001) was:
D7729D2D66272452
which translates to:
Feb 10, 2020
00:16:51.868274
GMT

The principal problem is in the QWHS common IFCID header where the QWHS_MOD_LVL is populated with EBCDIC blanks. We inspect the modification level and cannot process SMF data populated with blanks.

Maybe important to know: all Db2 subsystems were restarted with a conditional restart around that day/moment.
Fe 'DKC2', in local time: 
	conditional restart on 01.16.46 STC24859 ---- SUNDAY,    09 FEB 2020
	Stopped on 01.27.20
	Normal start 01.27.43 STC24950 ---- SUNDAY,    09 FEB 2020

This issue was already discussed with Bart Steegmans (IBM) and this case can be routed to him (cfr. Bart).

I've sended the SMF data type 100 from the 9th and 10th feb.

Please advice,
Jeroen.

SUBJECT: Tomcat Web-Anwendung verursacht \"Segmentation Error\" in der Java JVM, im JIT-Compiler \"libj9jit_29.so\"
DESCRIPTION:
Wir setzen ein Produkt vom IBM Business Partner, Fa. Veda in Alsdorf mit den Namen \"Horizon\" ein. Wir haben zum wiederholten Male einen Programmfehler mit Dump. Am Sonntag wurde das Java-Gruppen-PTF SF99665 von Version 5 auf Version 6 angehoben; Ite Sponve ist leider geblieben. 

Anbei die Daten von unserem Hersteller:

Es handelt sich um einen \"Segmentation Error\" in der Java JVM, genauer im JIT-Compiler \"libj9jit_29.so\".

D.h. die JVM hat den Zugriff auf einen Speicherbereich angefordert, der nicht vorher beim Betriebssystem reserviert wurde oder schon freigegeben wurde. 

Hier noch der relevante Auszug aus dem Log: 

Unhandled exception
*Type=Segmentation error* vmState=0x00000000
J9Generic_Signal_Number=00000018 Signal_Number=0000000b Error_Value=00000000 Signal_Code=00000033
[... ganz viele Speicheradressen ...]
Module=/QOpenSys/QIBM/ProdData/JavaVM/jdk80/64bit/jre/lib/ppc64/compressedrefs/libj9jit29.so
Module_base_address=09000000019E7000
Target=2_90_20191106_432135 (OS/400 V7R4M0)
CPU=ppc64 (16 logical CPUs) (0x3c00000000 RAM)

Ite Sponve tritt sporadisch auf und ist nicht reproduzierbar.

SUBJECT: Multistream backup / restore to filesystem not showing reduced execution times
DESCRIPTION:
Hello, 

IBM moved our mini mako to a new Datacentre at the end of last year for us and we are not seeing vastly increased times in our Netezza backup and restores. We are therefore looking at introducing multistream backups and restore to speed up these timings. 
We use filesystem backups and restores and the filesystem is connection by CIFS share. 
I have ran some backups and restores of a 6GB Database using 1, 2 and 4 streams but im not seeing much reduction of the backup times. I have attached the timings and the backup/restore logs. 
Are you able to comment on why the timings are not showing much improvement by using the multistreaming?

Thanks, 
Debbie

SUBJECT: Disconnecting 5250 Printer Sessions not clearing NETSTAT after switching Network Providers
DESCRIPTION:
We are having issues in which some of our 5250 sessions wont restart because there is an entry that remains in NETSTAT. 
This seems to be related to us switching network providers from ATT to Verizon. As our manufacturing locations are cut over to the Verizon circuit these locations are experiencing 5250 printer and display sessions that are becoming disassociated or orphaned from the iSeries server.
By disassociated I mean when I send a request from the thin client (CLI brand) to end/disconnect the session it isn't removing the entry in NETSTAT; therefore, I cant get the writer to go active until I remove the entry from NETSTAT. We are also trying a method of closing the session for about 10-15 minutes to see if it will allow the NETSTAT entry to clear. This does affect both printer and display sessions.
Once the entry is removed from NETSTAT I can start/stop the session from the client and see the the entry be added/removed from NETSTAT and of course the writer will stop and start as expected.
This is an ongoing issue at those locations that have cut over to Verizon happening on a regular basis. I also would like to add that weve had at least one IPL. 

My network guys insist that the Verizon service should be the same. Maybe faster. They are interested in getting this resolved and are curious of the cause. Im certain that its something on their end I just dont know what to have them look for. Since these sessions have been working properly for over 15 years and continue to not be an issue at those locations still on ATT, I dont want to fiddle with settings on our AS400 until weve exhausted options on the network side of things.


What do you suggest would be the likely things for me to have my network guys look for or compare between the two services?

PTFs and Group have been attached.

Thank you for your time!

Sincerely,

Weron Ecrableas

SUBJECT: NTP services
DESCRIPTION:
Hi,

Due to some new MiFid Directives, we have to check the timestamps on our LPARs.

To do so, we want to use NTP commands. This is working fine on OPEN servers but it is actually not working when the request is sent to z/OS LPARs which means that the check is working everywhere except for z/OS LPARs. 

The command used is NTPDATE. So the control sends an NTPDATE request to the LPARs IP address on port 123 (NTP port) and waits for an answer. But there is no answer (except: unreachable). The request is sent over UDP.

Our question:  what has to be implemented / started in order to be able to respond to these NTP requests sent to our LPARs? 

Kind regards,
Robert

SUBJECT: IMS high response time during /DBR command

On our production LPAR, on 22/4/2020 between 19.31.50 and 19.33.00 there was a serious service degradation on IMP4 with most impact for Mobile Banking (EB*).

SUBJECT: Not deterministic result from the query
DESCRIPTION:
[plimeduatel@maskedemail.ibm.com in a name of the Bank Millennium]
We created view which is based on other views and tables. All ddls has been attached in VIEW_DDLS.sql. Each time when we fetch data using select , insert into  etc. statements without any \"where\" conditions different result are give. We replicated that case on IAS (PRD) and Db2wh (DEV).
For a better test we created tmp table , inserted all rows from the view and compare the result using except.
Each time we retrieve different outcome. It looks like one row is somehow omitted in the result in the view randomly.
We understand that source tables can be modified by dml operations but view in fact groups data from the structures that are SCD2 (history of changes ) so each time after the grouping we should retrieve only one row for a group that already exists.
When You run following query You will see that the result is  null (now rows, incorrect situation) or one row that is missing in the tmp table.
The problem appears when You compare all data. When You add condition for that, one particular case the except operations finishes correctly give one row of the difference.
This is a blocker for a financial reporting

SELECT *

from SBX_PROTOTYPE.TMP_CONTRACT_LEASING_DETAILS_SM_MIN --WHERE COMPONENT_CONTRACT_SK='71#142172#0'
);

SUBJECT: Strange behavior in \"if statement with -e flag\" with ksh93
DESCRIPTION:
Hello, 

for our monitoring we have a special setup, with a setuid binary which calls a ksh93 script. This way we found strange behavior in the ksh93 irt whoami / id and the -e flag.

for this testcase we copied /usr/bin/ksh93 to a testdir, and set the setuid bit:
# ls -al /usr/bin/ksh93 
-r-xr-xr-x    2 bin      bin         2384263 Oct 14 2019  /usr/bin/ksh93
# cp /usr/bin/ksh93 .
# chmod u+s ksh93
# ls -al ksh93
-r-sr-xr-x    1 root     checkmk     2384263 Apr 28 16:22 ksh93

The actual 'bug':

$ ./ksh93
# whoami
root
# id
uid=6008(checkmk) gid=6008(checkmk) euid=0(root)
# if [ -e $HOME/.profile ]; then
> whoami
> id
> fi
checkmk
uid=0(root) gid=6008(checkmk) euid=6008(checkmk)

and this is still the case after the if statement:
# id
uid=0(root) gid=6008(checkmk) euid=6008(checkmk)
# whoami 
checkmk

This setup works on vios 2.2.6.51
If we use the -f flag instead of the -e flag, we do not face this behavior.

The normal ksh doesn't seem to be affected.

SUBJECT: Customized IMS exit for IMS Log Reader Service, picks up incorrect PORT
DESCRIPTION:
While implementing Change Data Capture, we modified the Partner Program exit - DFSPPUE0. 
After customizing the USERSAMP member - CECE1OPT - and running the sample jobs, including an ASSEMBLE and RE-LINK of the exit - CECLRIL6.
During system customization, the following communication parameters were defined 
- Server hostname or IP            =   cdcimsv.absa.co.za
                                                              (22.147.71.15)
- Server listen port                      =   35223
- Log reader notification port   =   35226
The problem that we experience, is that even after several attempts to implement these values, whenever you start the IMS control region, post the ASM and LNK, the log reader notification port, changes to - 30310

Nowhere in our source do we specify - 30310.
Nobody is quite sure where this comes from.
There is some who seem to remember that this might be a port defined on the Kafka agent server.
But no calrity on this.

Any suggestions will be appreciated.
I'll forward any docs when requested.

Regards,

Fanie

SUBJECT: Different access paths for same SQL
DESCRIPTION:
Hello

We are currently running DB2 V12 FL 100 and have a very strange problem.  
We have an SQL that when executed in a local websphere application gets after a few minutes an SQLCODE -904 because it used all the available space in our workfile database. However, when we execute the exact same SQL locally in TSO Spufi or in a distributed fashion on the same DB2 member with DB Visualizer the SQL terminates successfully in less than two seconds elapsed time. DB Visualizer is a JDBC based tool allowing execution of dynamic SQL, the version of the JDBC driver used is the same as for the websphere application, the only difference being that one connection uses the type 2 and the other the type 4 connectivity. We noticed that in WAS the SQL executes a tremendous amount of getpages and that it uses different indexes, so that we conclude that DB2 uses different access paths in both cases.
The project needs to be fully functioning in about 3 weeks so right now we could only bypass the problem and tell them to try to rewrite the SQL to get it to work.  They will not start immediately the rewriting to give us a chance to reproduce the error and collect all the information you may need to gain some insight. However, in 2 weeks at the latest they would have to begin the rewriting if we do not come up with another solution.  
Here the error produced in WAS:
SQLCODE = -904, SQLSTATE = 57011, error tokens = 00C90084;00000100;WRKDB4P
ERRORCODE=-904, SQLSTATE=57011       

Here the SQL involved:
WITH                                                                            
    PERSONNES_AVEC_CB_EU                                                        
    (                                                                           
        CBEU_MEMBRE_ID,                                                         
        MATRICULE,                                                              
        DATE_DELIVRANCE,                                                        
        PAYS_CBEU                                                               
    ) AS                                                                        
    (                                                                           
        SELECT                                                                  
            D1.FK_MEMBRE_ID,                                                    
            PS1.PERS_UNIQUE_ID,                                                 
            D1.DEMA_DATE_CHANGE_ETAT,                                           
            CASE                                                                
                WHEN P1.PAYS_CODE_EUROSTAT IS NULL                              
                THEN TRIM(P1.PAYS_CODE_ISO2)                                    
                ELSE TRIM(P1.PAYS_CODE_EUROSTAT)                                
            END                                                                 
        FROM                                                                    
            AEIMM.TS_DEMANDE D1,                                                
            AEIMM.TS_CATEGORIE C1,                                              
            AEIMM.TS_PAYS P1,                                                   
            AEIMM.TS_MEMBRE M1,                                                 
            AEIMM.TS_PERSONNE PS1                                               
        WHERE                                                                   
            C1.FK_DEMANDE_ID = D1.PK_DEMANDE_ID                                 
        AND C1.FK_ETAT_CATEGORIE_ID = 4                                         
        AND D1.FK_ETAT_DEMANDE_ID = 9                                           
        AND C1.FK_TYPE_DEMAN

SUBJECT: (KB) LTP Modify/Extend - RC 8, REASON CODE 0012 After creating new version AD with Shift + 1 Day
DESCRIPTION:
Hi,

We encountered a problem on production with the extend of LTP job when adding a new version of an AD that runs on workingsdays with shift +1 day. As a workaround we pushed back the valid from date to after the LTP end, the extend job was restarted and finished sucessfully.

Afterwards we tried duplicting this problem on a different LPAR with the same outcome. 
Steps to reproduce v1:
1. Create AD with Shift +1 day, valid from within LTP range
2. Run Modify LTP job
2. Copy newly created AD with new valid from +1 week after valid from of first version & within LTP range
4. Run Modify LTP job => abend with EQQN043I VSAM RETURN CODE IS 8, REASON CODE IS 0012

Steps to reproduce v2:
1. Create AD with Shift +1 day, valid from within LTP range
2. Run Modify LTP job
2. Copy newly created AD with new valid from outside LTP range
4. Run Extend LTP job to include newly defined AD => abend with EQQN043I VSAM RETURN CODE IS 8, REASON CODE IS 0012

Furthermore after running the Modify LTP job and causing this problem, the LTP VSAM was corrupted and we had to restore the backup to be able to rerun Modify LTP job succesfully. After Extend LTP job abends, it is possible to rerun it succesfully after changing AD definitions, unless a modify LTP job has ran in the meantime, then LTP backup has to be restored aswell.

SUBJECT: Abend na execuo do XML PARSE do Cobol 6.2

Boa tarde.

Esta ocorrendo abends num programa compilado com Cobol6.
A primeira execuo do programa funciona normalmente. 
Nas demais execues ocorre abend 0C1 ou 0C4 (fica variando) no modulo
__fnwsa     HLE77B0:edcfnwsa.c 

O problema ocorre no XML PARSE  abaixo.

*    Executa Parse da Area de Negocio                 
     XML  PARSE WQTXD-MSGENT (1:WQTXD-TAM-MSGENT)     
          PROCESSING PROCEDURE RT-EXEC-PARSE          
     ON   EXCEPTION                                   
          IF WS-FIM-OK = 'S'                          
             NEXT SENTENCE                            
          END-IF                                      
          IF (XML-CODE = 6) AND                       
             (WQTXD-MSGENT (WS-AUX2:1) = WDE1 OR      
              WQTXD-MSGENT (WS-AUX2:1) = WDE2)        
              PERFORM RT-INSPECT                      
              GO TO RT-PARSE-XML-CONTINUE             
          END-IF                                      
          MOVE 30001        TO WQTXD-COD-ERRO         
          PERFORM RT-TRATA-ERRO                       
     NOT ON EXCEPTION                                 
          CONTINUE

SUBJECT: NFS Mount-Problem Bara Onoter
DESCRIPTION:
Bara Onoter werden NFS-Verzeichnisse von einem NAS-System nicht zuverlssig gemountet.

SUBJECT: DRF task abends - S878

When doing the recovery on our Live systems, the recovery is successful.
The DR systems are created by stopping replication to the DR boxes and using BCV's to recover the whole system.
So, in theory, it's a copy of the Live system with the same definitions, parameters and space allocations.
For database recoveries we use DRF with both the IMS logs and Change Accumulation as input.
Manipulating the REGION= allocation and the number of databases per recovery, still does not resolve the issue.

We are using - IMS v15.1.
DRF - as part of IMS Recovery Pack v2.1
The OS is z/OS 2.3.

Any assistance will be appreciated.

Fanie

SUBJECT: MODIFY STATISTICS  spending too much getpages
DESCRIPTION:
Hi team
.
We are running following MODIFY utility:
.
LISTDEF LISTMOD INCLUDE TABLESPACE D1TST01.S1TSTIDA 
INCLUDE INDEXSPACES                                 
TABLESPACE D1TST01.S1TSTIDA                         
MODIFY STATISTICS LIST LISTMOD DELETE ALL AGE(180)  
.
We observed that it's spending too much getpages on catalog, because of LISTDEF and having INCLUDE INDEXSPACES TABLESPACE clause
.
INTERVAL = UTILINIT               CPU (SEC)          = 0.476373              ZIIP = 0.000000                  
   LEVEL = PHASE                  ELAPSED TIME (SEC) = 1.787                                                  
                                                                                                              
  BUF POOL     GETPAGES     SYS SETW    SYNC READS    SYNC WRITE    SEQ PREFCH   LIST PREFCH    DYN PREFCH    
  --------   ----------   ----------    ----------    ----------    ----------   -----------    ----------    
  BP0             60235            1             5                                                       3    
  BP32K              84            5                                                                    11    
                                                                                                              
  TOTAL           60319            6             5                                                      14    
.
I started a trace, to see where the job was spending these getpages:
.
-Wisherverowarowashoottionsetwertudembefursiginame ,Oul) TDATA(CPU
, COR, TRA) CORRID(C001SILT)                                      
.
In OMEGAMON trace report, we saw that there is a sequential scan on TS SYSTSTAB. And this is causing the great amount of getpages, as this Datasharing Group has more than 660.000 rows in systables.
.
SEQ. SCAN  --> C001SILT                                               
 BEGIN         NETWORKID:  BBNETCEN  LUNAME:  DB23P41   LUWSEQ:     3 
               DBID DSNDB06      REC ID           19                  
               OBID SYSTSTAB     PSID        X'07DE'                  
               CUB  X'07000030'  SCAN TYPE        SQ                  
               COL1   OP      COL/VAL           CONN    T/F    ST     
                   4  LI  X'C4F1E3E2E3F0F140'      A   'NONE'         
                   4  NE  X'C4E2D5C4C2F0F640'      A   'NONE'         
                   4  NE  X'C4E2D5C4C2F0F140'      A   'NONE'         
                   5  LI  X'E2F1E3E2E3C9C4C1'      A   'NONE'         
                   3  NE  X'C100000000000000'      A   'NONE'         
                   3  NE  X'C700000000000000'      A   'NONE'         
                   3  NE  X'E500000000000000'  'NONE'  'NONE'         
.
If we change the syntax to this, it works better, as it uses an index instead of sequential scan
.
LISTDEF TABLESPACE INCLUDE TABLESPACE  D1TST01.S1TSTIDA 
MODIFY STATISTICS LIST TABLESPACE DELETE ALL AGE(180)    
LISTDEF LISTMOD INCLUDE INDEXSPACES LIST TABLESPACE      
MODIFY STATISTICS LIST LISTMOD DELETE ALL AGE(180)       
.
I'm sending the Utility SYSOUT, the trace we started and the RECTRACE report.
.
Can you please help us with this problem?
.
Best regards, Silton

SUBJECT: Differenza Ora di sistema fra partizione di Produzione e di Flash
DESCRIPTION:
Buongiorno,
questa mattina mentre verificavo il corretto completamento dei backup da parte della partizione di Flash ho notato che l'orario della partizione di Flash e di circa un ora \"avanti\" rispetto a quello effettivo e corretto presente nella partizione di Produzione.
Ulteriore conferma e conseguenza di questa situazione anomala  l'accavallarsi delle informazioni nel log del BRMS che viene riportato indietro dalla partizione di flash a quella di produzione al termine della esecuzione dei Backup.
Per maggior chiarezza allego un filmato eseguito questa mattina. Nella parte sinistra dello schermo si vede il log della partizione di Produzione. In quella di destra il log della partizione di Flash.
Sino al messaggio \"L'accesso all'ASP  sospeso\" i messaggi sono identici come tipo ed orario ( entrambi i messaggi sono alle 06:40:11 su entrambe le partizioni) 
Dal messaggio dopo che segna la separazione dei LOG (in quanto a questo punto la partizione di Flash si avvia e ha il suo proprio LOG) si nota come nella partizione di Flash il primo messaggio successivo all'ultimo comune \"Lavoro 000000/QSYS/SCPF avviato il 12/05/20 alle '7:30:29\"  indica chiaramente come nella partizione di Flash l'ora sia stata cambiata in modo drastico..

Questo comporta poi che tutti gli orari scritti nel log del BRMS siano sbagliati.
Ora una volta completato il backup la partizione di Flash trasferisce i dati necessari al DB del BRMS sulla partizione principale e si spegne.

Questo comporta che il log del BRMS che si legge sulla partzione principale riporti un'ora sbagliata.

Infatti come si vede dall'altro allegato si nota come l'operazione del Maintenance sembra esser stata avviata alle 09:52:19 e cio nel bel mezzo di una operazione di Backup...

L'errore  che tutti gli orari relativi ai processi di Backup come ad esempio:
 12/05/20   9:54:59  Save of list *LINK completed with errors.  
sono in realt stati eseguiti circa un ora prima..

A cosa pu esser dovuta quest'orario non corretto nella partizione di Flash..?

Grazie mille per il supporto.

Attendo un vostro gentile riscontro in merito.

Volon Truce
Per conto di Suzuki Italia Spa

.
Today we got a dump, but it was partial, as MAXSPACE LIMIT was reached. Our MAXSPACE = 80.000 MEG. I think this is a very high MAXSPACE, and we don't know we can increase it. SUBJECT: IASP lost when upgrade Storwize 8.3.1.1
DESCRIPTION:
Hi
I reported Case TS003704640 that our IASP went down when we upgraded to 8.3.1.1. The support wanted me to create a ticket to you.

What we did was the following
1. Upgrade the V5010 to Version 8.3.1.1, no microcode for disk drives since they are at the latest level.

2. The upgrade went good without any problems.

3. logged into lpar FSYS and looked into the logs, we then saw Jush Dity was Vary OFF. Customer called us that they had problem to connect to the system, and we informed that we are activating IASP since it went down.

4. Just did a quick look and found for ex CPI096F, CPPEA35, CPPEA33, CPIB711

5. WRKCLU opt 10, and display session told us that FYSBACK was in replication status \"Suspend\",  so we did a \"RESUME\", which only went to \"RESUMEPEND\". This was because the iASP was Varied Off. So we changed the replication status back to \"Suspend\" and Varied On the iASP, and then we did \"RESUME\" the replicatoin state again, and the replication started to sync.


Yes customer have VIOS1 and VIOS2 NPIV for fiber connection
Please let me know what you need, and also a good instructions on how to collect the data
Thank you and regards Sandra
