SUBJECT: Why the lock request returns einval with NFSv4 and not NFSv3
DESCRIPTION:
Dobr den,

Tm RTODS pouv pro \"registraci\" IPX klienta NFS svazek, kter je pipojen na AIX a Linux servery, jako NFS server je NetApp. Na Linuxu je pipojen pomoc NFSv4 i NFSv4.1, a ve funguje. Na AIXu pi pipojen pomoc NFSv4 dochz k chyb, od dodavatele mme vyjden (ne), pro NFSv3 ve funguje.

---
With the NFS version 4 protocol, the support for file locking is part of the NFS protocol. The file locking support is structured so that an RPC callback mechanism is not required. This is a departure from the previous versions of the NFS file locking protocol, Network Lock Manager (NLM). The state associated with file locks is maintained at the server under a lease-based model. The server defines a single lease period for all states held by an NFS client. If the client does not renew its lease within the defined period, all state associated with the client's lease may be released by the server. The client may renew its lease with use of the RENEW operation or implicitly by use of other operations (primarily READ).

The failure we are seeing at this customer site is on a fcntl call to establish a read lock, so the customer should really ask the question of IBM as to why the lock request returns einval with NFSv4 and not NFSv3.

In other words this is not a problem with our code per se, but with the NFS implementation.
---

Dkuji
Petr Kozk
esk Spoitelna, a. s.

SUBJECT: Reading from freshly created table which uses Field Procedure on a field and contains at least one record produces error  <FIELD PROCEDURE NAME> not valid for operation. Cause:  The reason code is 56 ..
DESCRIPTION:
In the joblog there is an preceding escape message CPF9898, with text Unknown SQL type passed.
The error is thrown before the field procedure is even called for field decoding.  
The bug seems to depend on how/if  labels are set on columns.
The data in table are not touched, it is possible to drop field procedure and all data are again accessible just fine. 
When the field procedure is defined using  ALTER TABLE the problem does not arise. 
Attachment:
  SQL script for reproducing the problem; contains command for creating field procedure program and 
proper sql statements reproducing the behaviour.  Source for the field procedure is in the library FLDPRCBUG. 
The field procedure is deliberately made as simple as possible. It is defined to operate only on VARCHAR fields and does not
modify the data. At encoding or decoding phase it just copies data from one buffer to another.
Note:  
   When you uncomment line in LABEL ON COLUMN  statement, i.e. when label is put on field FIELD3, the bug does not appear,
the Select statement runs fine.

Cheers

Peter

SUBJECT: SMF DUMPING with LOGGER (Advanced)
DESCRIPTION:
we have been testing SMF LOGSTREAM vs DATASET recording for several months now on our sandbox systems.   Based on IBMs recommendation of keeping the SMF MANx DSNs around in case we need to go back to DATASET recording - we have Automated several commands and messages to make sure the SMF data is always dumped in the order that it was created.  For instance, we trap the SETSMF RECORDING command and check to what we are changing the recording method.  Then if going from LOGSTREAM to DATASET, we issue our command to offload the SMF LOGGed data to the common GDG.  If going from DATASET to LOGSTREAM then message IEE391A is generated by the system which starts our normal SMF dump process.
We also coded and tested for message IXG283I and dump the SMF LOGGed data after every 3 times it is produced for a logstream with IFASMF in the logstreamname.
We thought we were golden.
Then we started playing with Digital Signing.  We created a new SMFPRMxx member and kept everything the same as the other SMFPRMxx member expect we added the TOKEN and HASH parameters.

To turn this testing, we thought we would enter SET SMF=nn where nn in our case was 15.  We were already in LOGSTREAM mode since we previously issued the SETSMF RECORDING(LOGSTREAM).  When the SET SMF=15 was issued, we went back to DATASET recording and obviously Digital Signing does not work with DATASET recording, but that was not the big issue, but the fact that if we did not realize that it switched back to DSN recording, we would not have dumped the SMF data from the LOGGER file and the data would have been out of order or missing.

Is there a command that can return the SMF RECORDING setting ?
Can you put out a message that indicates the the recording medium has changed ?

We want to be able to Automate it all.

SUBJECT: Omegamon error KLVRS002 INVALID RSS RELEASE REQUEST triggered during IPLs.
DESCRIPTION:
Omegamon error KLVRS002 INVALID RSS RELEASE REQUEST triggered during IPLs.

At the weekend we had KLVRS002 errors reported in 2 of our Omegamon KCTPROC address spaces (Remote TEMS), while other LPARS within the same SYSPLEX were being re-ipld.

In or WS LPAR we first received the error:
03.46.22 STC15132 ---- SATURDAY,  08 FEB 2020 ----                  
03.46.22 STC15132  IEA794I SVC DUMP HAS CAPTURED:  933              
   933             DUMPID=001 REQUESTED BY JOB (KCTPROC )           
   933             DUMP TITLE=KLVRS002 INVALID RSS RELEASE REQUEST  

Then in our NI LPAR 14 seconds later, we received the message:
03.46.34 STC09470 ---- SATURDAY,  08 FEB 2020 ----                 
03.46.34 STC09470  IEA794I SVC DUMP HAS CAPTURED:  991             
   991             DUMPID=002 REQUESTED BY JOB (KCTPROC )          
   991             DUMP TITLE=KLVRS002 INVALID RSS RELEASE REQUEST

At around this time 3 other LPARS within the same Sysplex, GC, HA and CL were being re-ipld.

We have had a similar issue to this before, with KCTPROC abending when other LPARS are being IPLd , which we reported in case TS002578655.

On the LPARS being restarted this time around, Omegamon was stopped in each at 03:27, with only CL having had Omegamon restarted before we received the KLVRS002 error.

If its any help, the full sequence of events was as follows:

03:27:25	KCTPROC on CL LPAR closed down
03:27:50	KCTPROC on GC LPAR closed down
03:27:52 	KCTPROC on HA LPAR closed down
03:43:09	CL LPAR Reipld
03:44:43	Omegamon restarted in CL LPAR
03:45:54	GC LPAR Reipld
03:46:22	KLVRS002 error in NI LPAR
03:46:34	KLVRS002 error in WS LPAR	
03:47:35	Omegamon restarted in the GC LPAR
03:49:07	HA LPAR Reipld
03:50:49	Omegamon restarted in the HA LPAR

The KLVRS002 ABEND itself does not bring the KCTPROC started task down, however in the past when weve seen this error, KCTPROC has been seen to produce an excessive amount of output in its RKLVSNAP dataset, which can fill the JES spool. To avoid this problem we have automation bounce KCTPROC whenever we see the KLVRS002 error.

When we reported this issue before, we were advised to apply the following fixes:
UA99841 
UA98643  
UA98644 
UA98845

These fixes are applied in all of our Omegamon LPARS and we have also applied the recommended service for Omegamon up to early September 2019.

I have attached the 2 system dumps created by the KLVRS002 errors and the Logs for the NI and WS KCTPROC tasks. 

Have you any further ideas on how we could tackle this problem?

SUBJECT: z/VM Paging and Spooling DASD recommendations
DESCRIPTION:
We are currently running z/VM 6.4 RSU 1702+ soon to migrate to 7.1.
Our primary z/VM system just passed 1 TB of real memory and continues to grow.  IBM used to recommend using the same DASD geometry for all paging packs (and spooling) for performance. Based on this we have continued to add Mod 9s and are now up to 144. Along with spool packs we are begining to get close to the 256 limit for slots. We have 8 channels to each controller and will soon be implementins z/HPF(HDS disk, per mgmt decision). We are now preparing for a DASD refresh and are wondering: 
1. Does IBM still recommend keeping all paging (and spooling) on the same geometry? or could we go to a mix of Mod 9 and Mod 27 (or Mod 54)
2. Would there be any performance issues going from Mod 9 to Mod 27 (or Mod 54)? 
(We are not interested in EDEV for this function at this time.)
Any guidence you can give us in this area would be helpful. 
Terry

SUBJECT: Assistance required with performance of IBM i process
DESCRIPTION:
Hi

We have a Java step/process within a job that is taking almost 3 times as long to complete since 27/1/20.
		Up to and including the 27/1/20, the Java step/process in question was taking approx 60 minutes to complete.
		Since 28/1/20 the Java step/process in question is taking approx 150 minutes to complete.

The Java step/process in question has a name of generateNominalextract (I think this is a custom in-house name?) and it runs the following SQL statement.
====================================
	select nm.id from NominalMovement nm join transaction t on nm.transaction_id = t.id join account a on t.ACCOUNT_ID = a.id 
	where a.CORPORATEUNIT_CODE = '#{jobParameters[MI_EXTRACT_CORPORATE_UNIT_CODE]}' and 
	(
	(nm.lastUpdatedDateTime >= 
	(select mi.lastExtractDate from MIExtractControl mi where mi.CORPORATEUNIT_CODE = a.CORPORATEUNIT_CODE and  mi.type='NOMINAL') and nm.lastUpdatedDateTime <= '#{jobParameters[MI_EXTRACT_JOB_START_TIMESTAMP]}')
		  or 
	(nm.createdDateTime >=
		  (select mi.lastExtractDate from MIExtractControl mi where mi.CORPORATEUNIT_CODE = a.CORPORATEUNIT_CODE and 
	mi.type='NOMINAL') and nm.createdDateTime <= '#{jobParameters[MI_EXTRACT_JOB_START_TIMESTAMP]}')
	)
	and nm.generalLedgerKeyCode is not null
====================================

The application in question runs on WebSphere which connects via JDBC to the IBM i DB as the user EBDTAPRD.

I would appreciate some assistance in investigating the cause of the additional run time of this Java step.

I have performance data for 27/1/20 and 28/1/20 which I can provide if you require.

Many thanks

Bryn

SUBJECT: Uising KC4z for CICS/TS
DESCRIPTION:
I'm trying to get all of the z/OS and products documentation in one place with one (easy) access. I have z/OS 2.2 and 2.3 KC books and 2.3 PDFs in /sharedapps/kc4z/data/content per the read.me at /systems/z/zos/sftp/kc . CICS/TS 5.4 is next.

I have two questions: 1) What is the process and 2) What is the source for the CICS docs that can be used with/installed under KC4z?

1) Process
Per the \"CICS Transaction Server for z/OS 5.4.0> What documentation is available?\" web page, CICS PDFs are available for KC. Following the \"Downloadable documentation\" link there is a section \"IBM Knowledge Center for z/OS\" which says \"... you can use the z/OS Softcopy Librarian feature to load CICS TS documentation into this version of IBM Knowledge Center. See Using IBM Knowledge Center for z/OS for more information.\" Note the reference to Softcopy Librarian which per case TS003547736 is \"obsolete.\" 

But, just in case, I cranked up Softcopy Librarian and opened the \"CICS TS and Performance Analyzer\" source. Opening the source file I get a choice of three zip files and the option to \"Send to\" either of my repositories, one of which is KC \"/sharedapps/kc4z/data/content/\" and the other is the Library Server shelves that I maintain for PDFs not available in KC. Is it safe to send one of the zip files to /sharedapps/kc4z/data/content/? And what do I do with it once there?

Following the \"Using IBM Knowledge Center for z/OS\" link, in the third paragraph I read \"You can manually add content to Knowledge Center for z/OS by copying it to z/OS directories. You can also automatically add content using the z/OS SoftCopy Librarian tool. By adding content, you can make Knowledge Center for z/OS serve product publications for many different IBM products.\" Note the reference to Softcopy Librarian again. In the same sentence \"You can manually add content to Knowledge Center for z/OS by copying it to z/OS directories.\" and the fifth paragraph includes a link to \"IBM Knowledge Center for z/OS Configuration and User Guide.\"

Chapter 3. Managing product documentation content in Knowledge Center for z/OS of the User Guide, \"Adding content manually to Knowledge Center for z/OS, for a product, is possible if you copy product plugins to a content directory yourself, build and add your own product properties file to a conf.path directory, and register (if necessary) the product id with the Knowledge Center taxonomy file. The details for manually provisioning content are detailed in the following procedure: ....\" 

What or where are the \"product plugins\" for CICS? Where do I find the information to populate the \"product.properties\" file, register the product in the Knowledge Center taxonomy file, and edit the KC_taxonomy.ditamap file? 

2) Source
The Softcopy Librarian found zip file mentioned above (2nd paragraph of Process).

The /systems/z/zos/sftp/kc FTP site has a file \"SSGMCP_5.4.0.jar\" which I would imagine is compatible with \"receive.sh\" but the date (04-Jun-2019) doesn't match any of the seven downloads, the latest is 2/5/20, at the second source.

The /software/cics/knowledgecenter FTP site has multiple versions of the CICS 5.4 documentaion in zip files.

When un-zipped contain either a folder with the PDFs (cicsts540_pdfs_2020.01.30.zip) or multiple folders with the PDFs (cicsts540_pdfs.zip) but neither contains the referenced read.me in \"IBM Knowledge Center for CICS products\" \"The documentation is available at CICS information download site. A readme is provided in the package of documentation, and in this section. These packages are refreshed regularly. The documentation is available at CICS information download site. A readme is provided in the package of documentation, and in this section. These packages are refreshed r

SUBJECT: Corrupt file after FieldProc + Encryption conversion
DESCRIPTION:
CUSTOMER REP: Chris
SALESFORCE CASE: TS003690842
ENVIRONMENT: IBM i 7.3
PROBLEM: Data file is corrupted after FieldProc?
SEVERITY: Currently a sev 4
BUSINESS IMPACT: Unable to get FieldProc working

Problem: We are in a Adopted Authority security model and we are starting to add in encryption to sensitive data via fieldprocs and our own homegrown encrypt/decrypt software.  We have a Keystore library that contains DECRYPT, ENCRYPT, and KEY files.  When a user, a programmer or version control, go to add the fieldproc and encryption they take the following steps:
1. Create a dupe column and copy data over to the encrypted column.  This works perfectly.
2. In a separate program, the user then runs a script to:
a. allocate KEY, DECRYPT, and DECRYPT.
b. Remove triggers
c. drop unneeded columns
d. update comments on the file for our data dictionary
e. reattach triggers
f. deallocate objects

What ends up happening is somewhere between b and e, our file is becoming corrupted.  It appears to me that it might be dealing with the authority of the user running the programs that may not have authority to the Keylib.  Typically, it seems to happen in step D, which adds comments onto the new encrypted fields.

What could be causing this corruption?  If it is the authority, what do we need to set the authority at on the Keystore so we can avoid corrupting the file (both at the library and object level)?

SUBJECT: Etherchannel failure after NIM Alternate Disk Migration
DESCRIPTION:
After migrating productive Oracle DB cluster nodes from AIX 7.1 (7100-05-05-1937) to AIX 7.2 (7200-04-01-1939) we found that one etherchannel went into status \"defined\" and could not be re-activated. This happened on both cluster nodes immediately after the first reboot with AIX 7.2. Subsequent reboots did not change anything.

The failed Etherchannel is part of the Oracle Cluster Interconnect configuration. On the partner node (LPAR on our second E880 server) the equivalent configuration failed under the same cirumstances. Trying a rmdev/mkdev resulted in error message \"Error terminating device from driver\". On the other cluster node a cfgmgr ended with \"Error initializing a device into the kernel\".

Since we could not resolve the problem in the available maintenance window we restarted the cluster nodes using old_rootvg (AIX 7.1) und everything was OK. 
 
I know from a previous ticket (\"EEH errors and failed Etherchannel failover on E880 AIX 7.2 LPAR\", TS003300641) that there are a number of known issues with the underlying interface (PCIe3 100/1000 Base-TX 4-port Converged Network Adapter (df1020e214103c04)), see http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1SSRVPOAIX61HIPER181110-1747 and https://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IJ10293.

According to the IBM documentation adapters using the 'lncentdd' and 'lnc2entdd' drivers are affected. They can be found by using the following lsdev command:

rs21a:/home/sachs/$  lsdev -F \"name ddins\" | grep -e lncentdd -e lnc2entdd
ent14           pci/lncentdd
ent15           pci/lncentdd
ent16           pci/lncentdd
ent17           pci/lncentdd
rs21a:/home/sachs/$

ent17 is the port used for the etherchannel. Currently there is no backup adapter configured.

rs21a:/home/sachs/$ lsslot -c pci
# Slot                      Description                                        Device(s)
U78CA.001.CSS02J1-P1-C1-C1  PCI-E capable, Rev 3 16x lane slot with 16x lanes  pci4 pci5 pci6 fcs0 fcs1 fcs2 fcs3
U78CA.001.CSS03XY-P1-C1-C1  PCI-E capable, Rev 3 16x lane slot with 16x lanes  pci11 pci12 pci13 fcs4 fcs5 fcs6 fcs7
U78CA.001.CSS02J1-P1-C3-C1  PCI-E capable, Rev 3 16x lane slot with 16x lanes  ent0 ent1 ent2 ent3
U78CA.001.CSS03XY-P1-C3-C1  PCI-E capable, Rev 3 16x lane slot with 16x lanes  ent14 ent15 ent16 ent17 fcs10 fcs11
rs21a:/home/sachs/$


rs21a:/home/sachs/$ lsdev -Cc adapter
. . .
ent14 Defined   0E-00 PCIe3 10GbE SFP+ SR 4-port Converged Network Adapter (df1020e214100f04)
ent15 Defined   0E-01 PCIe3 10GbE SFP+ SR 4-port Converged Network Adapter (df1020e214100f04)
ent16 Available 0E-02 PCIe3 100/1000 Base-TX 4-port Converged Network Adapter (df1020e214103c04)
ent17 Available 0E-03 PCIe3 100/1000 Base-TX 4-port Converged Network Adapter (df1020e214103c04)
. . .

SUBJECT: IDAA0005 - ERROR IN DATA REPLICATION -  CDC
DESCRIPTION:
Hi IBM team,

today we faced some problems ralated to incremenatl updates - IBM InfoSphere Data Replication, on IDAA0005 - IIAS

We observed in the replication events (data studio) that after this error a bunch of tables was parked with idle state:

 Type: Error
Event ID: 9.215
Originator: SDT
Time: 22 de mai de 2020 03:48:30
Message:
CHC9215E DB2 has returned a permanent log data decompression error at LRSN X'00D7F473C12908B91A00', QW0306RC = X'00000008', QW0306RS = X'00C90063', QW0306DG = X'00C90081', table D1CDC01.DB2CDC.CMDO_CTB_DIAR_CDC requires decompression error mitigation

Then the subscription began to stop/start many times. Each time it restarts, a bunch of tables goes to idle state.

We also observed the follow message in the replication events:

Type: Error
Event ID: 9.816
Originator: com.datamirror.ts.target.publication.optimizer.bulkapply.TargetBulkApplyOptimizerJob
Time: 22 de mai de 2020 06:21:28
Message:
The UOW that was being applied when subscription DWABBEL0 last ran was only partially applied. CDC has processed the maximum number of operations a UOW could have without seeing the bookmark that terminated the UOW: 00520003C4F3F4F6C4F3C7F400D7F4941DC7A8A3CC000006000000000001715587DF700000D7F492C997BDCF54000001000000000000B5E730E42963000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000. Please refresh all tables in the subscription, or run the subscription in adaptive apply mode until the subscription mirror bookmark is past the bookmark that terminated the partially-applied UOW.

We tried to Restart incremental update processes from dwa-console, and the accelerator process restarted by itself, but the behavior of CDC doesn't change: the subscription continue to stop/start many times. Each time more tables whent to idle state.

Because more of 2/3 of our replicated tables were puted in idle state, and we must do a full refresh of those tables, we decided to do a disable/enable incremental updates and create a new subscription.


I'm sending a default trace with extensive diagnostic information and the sysout of the CHC STC.

We know that we lack in the upgrade to version 7.5.1 and IBM Synchronization but, until that happen, can you help us to understand the problem? We must make the CDC work fine with V7 until the upgrade.

server.                                                                 
                                                                        
We will upload a document with a explanation of the workload how to     
they found it.                                                          
                                                                        
So there are 2 thinks:                                                  
                                                                        
1 This is a security breach, passwords and ssh keys should never be     
plain text available in a log file.

finegraded enough, so in this case if a workload user has 'view         
workload resources admin' and  'view cloud group admin'  rights he also 
can read the log files from other  workloads teams although he doesn't  
have access rights on the instance itself.

Please take the following people on .cc in email response.
sbotiliattirstil@maskedemail.ibm.com
pludireeponts@maskedemail.ibm.com
roliffignisig@maskedemail.ibm.com

My findings and proposed changes are a result of my understanding from sessions with Pe Domme, Ballet Pieneeta and Jech Cip 
at either some IBM Technical University sessions or POWER virtual user group sessions and presentations.
If possible please involve Mr. Erguvan (foliatit@maskedemail.ibm.com) to validate the findings and changes.

First:   Enable Large Memory Pages for the dsmserv process

I looked at the cluster where only one TSM instance is runnig in a Standby-Failover scenario.
Based on the presentations of Deniz and Grover I calculated the needed large page segments.
(svmon -P <dsmserv process ID> |grep \"work text data BSS heap\" and count the number of segments in use)
-bash-4.3$ sudo svmon -P 3801564 |grep BSS
  bbde3b        12 work text data BSS heap           m   XXXX     X    X    XXXX
  a72e26        14 work text data BSS heap           m   1665     0    0    1665
  c90348        11 work text data BSS heap           m   1159     0    0    1159
  97fb97        13 work text data BSS heap           m    959     0    0     959
  8e088f        10 work text data BSS heap           m    659     0    0     659
  b90bb8        15 work text data BSS heap           m    556     0    0     556
  e52e64        16 work text data BSS heap           m    377     0    0     377

Grover published a formula (I can send you the presentation) 16x <number of BSS heap segments> + 32 ==  16x7+32 == 144.

Changes to AIX (on both cluster Nodes):
==> vmo -p -o lgpg_regions=144 -o lgpg_size=16777216 
==> bosboot a
==> reboot

chuser capabilities=CAP_BYPASS_RAC_VMM,CAP_PROPAGATE,CAP_NUMA_ATTACH <user_id fr TSM instance - here dbk01>

SUBJECT: aix 7200-04-02 mail aliases not working
DESCRIPTION:
Patched to aix 7200-04-02-2016.
Had issues with mail.  I see that sendmail was re-worked in this aix level.
https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/ssw_aix_72/filesreference/sendmail.cf.html
The doc (that I can find) is not very helpful.

My mail config is simple.  We do not run sendmail.  We allow outgoing mail only.  My only custom config is:
1.  DS entry in sendmail.cf (relay host)
2.  aliases in aliases
Never any problems with mail - until NOW.
So I finally got mail working to my mail address by adding
entry for #D{MTAHost}  in submit.cf with my relay host.

But I cannot get aliases to work.  
For example, I have alias named frankp -
frankp:     borsonvedenomis@maskedemail.ibm.com
I run mail in debug  ( -vvv)  and see the following -
>>> MAIL From:<bdow@maskedemail.ibm.com> SIZE=1080
250 sender <bdow@maskedemail.ibm.com> ok
>>> RCPT To:<egedin@maskedemail.ibm.com>
250 recipient <egedin@maskedemail.ibm.com> ok

Note - the alias does not get resolved.
Yes, I do run newaliases.   How do I fix?  Thx.

Any doc that lists changes?
